intro: Oldenlandia pseudocorymbosa, commonly known as the false spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a velvety texture. The species is notable for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
